title: Long compile time due to privacy checking private alias of public type

labels.name: I-compiletime
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to compile times.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Private type aliases of public types (e.g. `type V = f32;`) cause long compile times in the privacy checking phase. Making the type alias public resolves the issue. See https://github.com/iliekturtles/uom/issues/52 where the issue was originally identified and the work-around was found. See [privacy_checking.rs](https://gist.github.com/iliekturtles/1ca45b239c7133cdc259d5089535bc87) for a simple example to reproduce the problem.

The following command can be used to reproduce the problem with a private type alias.
```sh
time rustc +nightly --crate-type lib privacy_checking.rs -Ztime-passes --cfg 'feature="priv"' --cfg 'feature="T6"' --cfg 'feature="I5"'
```

Replacing the `priv` feature with `pub` shows that the issue is corrected when using a public type alias.
```sh
time rustc +nightly --crate-type lib privacy_checking.rs -Ztime-passes --cfg 'feature="pub"' --cfg 'feature="T6"' --cfg 'feature="I5"'
```

Varying the `T_` (number of types) and `I_` (number of trait `impl`s) features shows how compile times change. See the below test data from my machine. It looks like privacy checking of a private type alias of a public type is exponential with the number of types and becomes linear with a very slight slope when checking public aliases.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5081378/39883600-54fffb44-5455-11e8-9b9d-8f7ea0ece4ec.png)

Types | Impls | Ty x Impl | Time | Privacy checking | Time (pub) | Privacy checking (pub)
-- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | --
1 | 5 | 5 | 1.324 | 0.206 | 1.123 | 0.023
2 | 5 | 10 | 2.816 | 0.823 | 1.999 | 0.061
3 | 5 | 15 | 4.641 | 1.853 | 2.827 | 0.080
4 | 5 | 20 | 6.968 | 3.243 | 3.714 | 0.103
5 | 5 | 25 | 9.219 | 4.700 | 4.686 | 0.129
6 | 5 | 30 | 12.721 | 7.371 | 5.598 | 0.163
